intro: Hesperochiron villosulus, commonly known as the hairy legume, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems covered in fine, hairy pubescence. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pale green or white in color. Its trifoliate leaves consist of three oval-shaped leaflets with a prominent midrib. Hesperochiron villosulus is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of temperate climates.
